MetaData.MetaDataItem: Widom Smart Double Switch is the new ON/OFF smallest control device in the world designed to independently control two separate loads

ChangeLog.Entry: Some fixes comparing with openHab exported file

Value.label: Numbers of clicks to control the loads
Value.Help: Define which sequences of clicks control the load connected to both Channel 1 and Channel 2, if parameter No. 2 is set to its default value. Otherwise parameter No.1 sets the clicks sequence only for Channel 1 and parameter No. 2 sets the clicks sequence for Channel 2. 0 - Local Control disabled 1 - 1 click controls the local load 2 - 2 clicks control the local load 4 - 3 clicks control the local load 7 - The load connected to the Channel 1 can be controlled using 1 click, 2 clicks or 3 clicks Default value: 7 Other options: To control the load with 1 click and 2 clicks -> Parameter value must be 1 + 2 =3 To control the load with 1 click and 3 clicks -> Parameter value must be 1 + 4 =5 To control the load with 2 clicks and 3 clicks -> Parameter value must be 2 + 4 =6

Value.label: Numbers of clicks to control Channel 2 load
Value.Help: Defines which sequences of click control the load connected to Channel 2 0 - Local Control disabled 1 - 1 click controls the local load 2 - 2 clicks control the local load 4 - 3 clicks control the local load 8 - The load connected to the Channel 2 will be controlled with the same number of clicks configured for Channel 1 load. Default value: 8 Other options: To control the load with 1 click and 2 clicks -> Parameter value must be 1 + 2 =3 To control the load with 1 click and 3 clicks -> Parameter value must be 1 + 4 =5 To control the load with 2 clicks and 3 clicks -> Parameter value must be 2 + 4 =6 To control the load with 1 click, 2 clicks and 3 clicks -> Parameter value must be 1 + 2 + 4 =7

Value.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 2
Value.Help: Value used for devices belonging to Group 2 when external switch I1 receives 1 Click 1-99 : Dimming purpose 0 : OFF -1 : ON 100 : (Default Value) The same value of Channel 1 load status

Value.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 5
Value.Help: Value used for devices belonging to Group 5 when external switch I2 receives 1 Click 1-99 : Dimming purpose 0 : OFF -1 : ON 100 : (Default Value) The same value of Channel 2 load status

Value.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 3
Value.Help: Value used for devices belonging to Group 3 when external switch I1 receives 2 Clicks 1-99 : Dimming purpose 0 : OFF -1 : ON 100 : (Default Value) The same value of Channel 1 load status

Value.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 6
Value.Help: Value used for devices belonging to Group 6 when external switch I2 receives 2 Clicks 1-99 : Dimming purpose 0 : OFF -1 : ON 100 : (Default Value) The same value of Channel 2 load status

Value.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 4
Value.Help: Value used for devices belonging to Group 4 when external switch I1 receives 3 Clicks 1-99 : Dimming purpose 0 : OFF -1 : ON 100 : (Default Value) The same value of Channel 1 load status

Value.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 7
Value.Help: Value used for devices belonging to Group 7 when external switch I2 receives 3 Clicks 1-99 : Dimming purpose 0 : OFF -1 : ON 100 : (Default Value) The same value of Channel 2 load status

Value.label: Timer to switch OFF the Channel 1
Value.Help: Defines the time after which the Channel 1 load is switched OFF. 0 (Default Value) Timer disabled. From 1 to 32000 (seconds) After this time the relay of the Channel 1 is OFF.

Value.label: Timer to switch OFF the Channel 2
Value.Help: Defines the time after which the Channel 2 load is switched OFF. 0 (Default Value) Timer disabled. From 1 to 32000 (seconds) After this time the relay of the Channel 2 is OFF.

Value.label: Timer to switch ON the Channel 1
Value.Help: Defines the time after which the Channel 1 load is switched ON. 0 (Default Value) Timer disabled. From 1 to 32000 (seconds) After this time the relay of the Channel 1 is ON.

Value.label: Timer to switch ON the Channel 2
Value.Help: Defines the time after which the Channel 2 load is switched ON. 0 (Default Value) Timer disabled. From 1 to 32000 (seconds) After this time the relay of the Channel 2 is ON.

Value.label: Local Scenario
Value.Help: Defines the behavior of the device Channels when the I1/I2 external switches receive a valid number of clicks (see Parameters No. 1 and No. 2). Note: When to the parameter 40 is given a value different from zero, the associated devices will not be controlled.

Value.label: Start-up status
Value.Help: Defines the status of the device following a restart (Default Value: 4).

Value.label: Type of external switch
Value.Help: Defines the type of external switch connected both to input 1 and input 2, if parameter No. 63 is set in its default value. Otherwise parameter No. 62 defines only the external switch connected to the input 1 and parameter No. 63 the switch connected to the input 2. (Default Value: 1)

Value.label: Type of external switch
Value.Help: Defines the type of external switch connected both to input 1 and input 2, if parameter No. 63 is set in its default value. Otherwise parameter No. 62 defines only the external switch connected to the input 1 and parameter No. 63 the switch connected to the input 2. (Default Value: 1)
